abstract.text: Applies a flood fill-operation to an unsigned 16-bit planar image.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A pointer to a vImage buffer structure that contains the source image and receives the destination image. This function always works in place, that is, the input and the output point to the same memory.
A pointer to a temporary buffer. If you pass

, the function allocates the buffer and then deallocates it before returning. Alternatively, you can allocate the buffer yourself, in which case you’re responsible for deallocating it when you no longer need it.
The x-coordinate that defines the position of the seed pixel inside the connected component.
The y-coordinate that defines the position of the seed pixel inside the connected component.
The new pixel value that overwrites the pixels in the connected component.
An integer that specifies which pixels the operation includes as neighbors. Pass either
or
. The four-connected neighborhood of a pixel are the pixels to the left and right, and those above and below. The eight-connected neighborhood also includes the pixels on the four diagonals.
The options to use when performing the operation. If your code implements its own tiling or its own multithreading, pass
; otherwise, pass
; otherwise, one of the error codes in

The flood-fill function sets all pixels that are neighboring and identical to the seed pixel to a new color. The operation continues until it reaches the image boundary or until it sets all pixels within the connected component to the new value.

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
A type for a planar, 16-bits-per-channel, unsigned pixel.
Fill consistently colored connected parts of an image with a new color.

doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation.title: Applying flood fills to an image

abstract.text: A flag that disables vImage internal tiling routines.
The vImage function completed without error.
A flag that sets the behavior to the default.
Applies a flood-fill operation to an unsigned 16-bit-per-channel, four-channel interleaved image.
Applies a flood-fill operation to an 8-bit-per-channel, four-channel interleaved image.
Applies a flood fill-operation to an unsigned 16-bit planar image.
Applies a flood-fill operation to an 8-bit planar image.
A type for the number of pixels.
An image buffer that stores an image’s pixel data, dimensions, and row stride.
Look up type aliases, data types, and constants the vImage library uses.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
A raw pointer for accessing and manipulating untyped data.
